msbt.message: The patterns on clown fish are SO adorbs. And chic. And fab! Maybe I could work that look into my outfit?
These guys are small and cute on their ownbut they're kind of freaky in a big group. Kind of like trees
The sea butterfly is SO beautiful swimming around. They're probably even pretty when they're eating!
Koi have this aura of, you know, "not giving a care." We can learn a lot from nature.
This guppy makes me want to do a fish opera. I'd wear a frilly dress and dance under shimmering lights.
Betta are SO vogue. I always feel underdressed when I'm in the same room as one.
The surgeonfish's blue is so bright and pretty! And the black and yellow? It's so chic I could scream!But I won't, because Blathers doesn't like it when we do that.
Stringfish eat just about everything! No wonder they're so huge.
The scales on the arapaima look like armor. I should wear armor onstage. Not a lot of pop stars do that.
Napoleonfish are so goofy! I love them! They're the best! I mean just look at them!
I don't get how ocean sunfish swim with that shape. I'd end up smacking my head on the wall
The polka dots on the whale shark are SO hip! "Hip" is what folks used to say before they said "le bonkers"!BOOM! History lesson!
I can't EVEN handle how le beaut the arowana isgah! They're just one long, floppy, sparkly, gem!
The fins on coelacanth kind of look like arms <10_4 />Creepyfish arms
If I caught a char like this, I'd totes flex on the whole island!
Watching piranha tear into a meal is, um, hypnotic? Horrifying? Hypnotorrifying?
I heard that the great white shark can regrow its teeth over and over and over again! I'm so JELLY!<10_4 /> Wait. Why am I jealous?
Mahi-mahi have a great name. I should change my name to be like that!I could go be - , and when folks say my name, I'll say, "What-what?"
That oarfish has been staring at me so long I'm getting the creeps!<10_4 /> Maybe he thinks I'm a mermaid?!
I love how sturgeons' noses are all pointy-uppy! It's SO adorbs!
Gar have mouths that are all alligator-yand creepyand I'm going to stop looking now
A group of hammerhead sharks is called a "percussion."<10_4 /> That's not true, but it sounds good.
You're who donated that fish? Whaaaaat?! That's awesome!
